metadata:
Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve
Weeks Bay Reserve Boundary 2007WKB_RB_2007vector digital data\\DNR35017\C\ACE_GIS_projects\NERRS_GIS_Data\Weeks_Bay\Info_from_WKB\Reserve_boundary\WKB_RB_2007.shp
This file provides a polygon in ARCVIEW Shapefile format of the boundary of the Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve. In 1999 the Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) digital boundary was created as part of the Protected Areas Geographic Information System (PAGIS) project. At that time it was detemined that a digital version of the boundary was critical for the PAGIS project. It was delineated from management and research areas within the Reserve. It was not based on legal definitions. This updated digital polygon boundary was created by comparing the PAGIS boundary to the information found on the tax parcel boundaries for Baldwin County, Alabama. The tax parcel boundaries for Baldwin County is derived from a variety of public and private sources and is considered to be dependable, but the accuracy, completeness, currency, thereof are not garanteed. The tax parcel boundary dataset is created from MYLAR maps and was digitized by Southern Digital Mappin Inc. and delivered to Baldwin County. The Weeks Bay Reserve NERR boundary was clipped from the Baldwin County tax parcel boundary in order to increase the accuracy of the PAGIS digital boundary layer. The orginal PAGIS spatial reference is vector method in Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system, UTM zone 16;North American Datum of 1927, Clarke 1866; Units: Meters. The Baldwin County parcel spatial reference is vector method in StatePlane_Alabama_West_FIPS_0102; NAD83; Units Feet. Both were projected
enThe data provide users with information as to the boundary and location of the Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve, Alabama. For use in GIS and other applications Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.350020071999 (PAGIS boundary);2004 Baldwin Tax parcels2007 last edit to Weeks Bay NERR boundaryCompleteAs needed-87.853121-87.76912630.47577830.308912418111.912150426049.6887483353323.2890963371759.544222REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.REQUIRED: Common-use word or phrase used to describe the subject of the data set.NoneAcknowledgement Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources and/or Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve would be appreciated. Not for legal use.Shapefile11300 US Hwy 98mailing addressFairhopeAlabama36532USASarah JohnstonWeeks Bay NERRGIS Technician(251) 928-9792(251) 928-1792sarah.johnston@dcnr.alabama.govMonday through Friday 8am to 5pm CST (Central Standard Time)
These data are believed to be logically consistant. Polygon geometry is topologically clean. The boundary of the Reserve is dependent on the shoreline and/or edges of rivers and bays as delineated on a USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map or from Baldwin County tax parcel inforamtion. The edges or borders of the boundary might change as the natural land changes or better maps and aerial photography become available.
Horizantal_Positional_Accuracy_Report: Horizontal positional accuracy for the digital data is tested by visual comparison of the source. The data is as accurate as its source.
Accuracy: Attrigute_Accuracy_Report: No formal tests were performed
Since no previous digital boundary existed for Weeks Bay, one had to be created. A USGS 1.5 minute topographic map was sent to the Reserve as a reference map. The Reserve then delineated their oboundary by drawing on the printed map. The printed mapwas then sent back to the NOAACoastal Services Center and a digital file was created. The digital file was created with on-screen digitization with the USGS topographoic map as the backdrop. The polygon coveratge was attributed and then projected to hte final projection used by the individual Reserve.2009030213124300NOAA Coastal Services CenterPAGIS Internmailing and physical address234 South Hobson AvCharlestonSouth Carolina29405USA19980909Phil NixBaldwin Cnty Revenue Commissionmailing and physical address312 Courthouse Sq., Suite 13Bay MinetteAlabama36507USA251-937-0245251-937-0388pnix@co.baldwin.al.us8am-4:30pm, CSTDitital maps are created from MYLAR maps. These maps were digitized by Southern Ditital Mapping Inc.and delivered to Baldwin County in May 200. Subsequent updates are done daily and are based on the changed deeds or new deeds and subdivision plats. The maps existed in ArcInfo Librarian were imported into ArcSDE. Maps were double precisioned in Librarian.MYLAR Maps digitized by Sournern Digital Mapping Inx. and delivered to Baldwin County20060905Baldwin County Revenue Commission, Southern Digital Mapping Inx.Dataset moved.C:\ACE_GIS_projects\NERRS_GIS_Data\Weeks_Bay\WKBNERRboundary2009051310243700Dataset copied.I:\MB7\Projects\SITB\NERRS_Clement\CDMO Transfer\Bundled_boundaries\Bundled_boundaries\WKBNERRboundary2009102214432800Dataset moved.C:\ACE_GIS_projects\NERRS_GIS_Data\Weeks_Bay\Reserve_Boundaries\WKB_RB_20072010072816210300Metadata imported.C:\ACE_GIS_projects\NERRS_GIS_Data\Weeks_Bay\Reserve_boundary\WKB_RB_2007.shp.xml2010082314225400Dataset copied.C:\ACE_GIS_projects\NERRS_GIS_Data\Weeks_Bay\Reserve_boundary\weeks_bay_nerr2010082314370400Dataset copied.2010082314422100

This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. enFGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial MetadataFGDC-STD-001-1998local timehttp://www.esri.com/metadata/esriprof80.htmlESRI Metadata Profile This file provides a polygon in ARCVIEW Shapefile format of the boundary of the Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve. In 1999 the Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) digital boundary was created as part of the Protected Areas Geographic Information System (PAGIS) project. At that time it was detemined that a digital version of the boundary was critical for the PAGIS project. It was delineated from management and research areas within the Reserve. It was not based on legal definitions. This updated digital polygon boundary was created by comparing the PAGIS boundary to the information found on the tax parcel boundaries for Baldwin County, Alabama. The tax parcel boundaries for Baldwin County is derived from a variety of public and private sources and is considered to be dependable, but the accuracy, completeness, currency, thereof are not garanteed. The tax parcel boundary dataset is created from MYLAR maps and was digitized by Southern Digital Mappin Inc. and delivered to Baldwin County. The Weeks Bay Reserve NERR boundary was clipped from the Baldwin County tax parcel boundary in order to increase the accuracy of the PAGIS digital boundary layer. The orginal PAGIS spatial reference is vector method in Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate system, UTM zone 16;North American Datum of 1927, Clarke 1866; Units: Meters. The Baldwin County parcel spatial reference is vector method in StatePlane_Alabama_West_FIPS_0102; NAD83; Units Feet. Both were projected The data provide users with information as to the boundary and location of the Weeks Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve, Alabama. For use in GIS and other applications

NOAA Coastal Services Center 1999 Weeks Bay, Alabama National Estuarine Research Reserve Digital Polygon Boundary map
2400 Digital Restar Graphic/USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map Ditital Raster Graphic/USGS 7.5 minute Topographic Map USGS Topographic Map
Range_of__Dates/Times: publication date
NOAA-CSC NOAA Coastal Services Center was the original creator of the dataset
Since no previous digital boundary existed for Weeks Bay, one had to be created. A USGS 1.5 minute topographic map was sent to the Reserve as a reference map. The Reserve then delineated their oboundary by drawing on the printed map. The printed mapwas then sent back to the NOAACoastal Services Center and a digital file was created. The digital file was created with on-screen digitization with the USGS topographoic map as the backdrop. The polygon coveratge was attributed and then projected to hte final projection used by the individual Reserve.

Ditital maps are created from MYLAR maps. These maps were digitized by Southern Ditital Mapping Inc.and delivered to Baldwin County in May 200. Subsequent updates are done daily and are based on the changed deeds or new deeds and subdivision plats. The maps existed in ArcInfo Librarian were imported into ArcSDE. Maps were double precisioned in Librarian.
